00020 #ifndef __L4UTIL__INCLUDE__ARCH_AMD64__BITOPS_ARCH_H__
00021 #define __L4UTIL__INCLUDE__ARCH_AMD64__BITOPS_ARCH_H__

00026  *** Implementation

00028 
00029 /* set bit */
00030 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_SET_BIT32
00031 L4_INLINE void
00032 l4util_set_bit32(int b, volatile l4_uint32_t * dest)
00033 {
00034   __asm__ __volatile__
00035     (
00036      "btsl  %1,%0   \n\t"
00037      :
00038      :
00039      "m"   (*dest),   /* 0 mem, destination operand */
00040      "Ir"  (b)       /* 1,     bit number */
00041      :
00042      "memory", "cc"
00043      );
00044 }
00045 
00046 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_SET_BIT64
00047 L4_INLINE void
00048 l4util_set_bit64(int b, volatile l4_uint64_t * dest)
00049 {
00050   __asm__ __volatile__
00051     (
00052      "btsl  %1,%0   \n\t"
00053      :
00054      :
00055      "m"   (*dest),   /* 0 mem, destination operand */
00056      "Ir"  (b)       /* 1,     bit number */
00057      :
00058      "memory", "cc"
00059      );
00060 }
00061 
00062 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_SET_BIT
00063 L4_INLINE void
00064 l4util_set_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00065 {
00066   return l4util_set_bit64(b, (volatile l4_uint64_t*)dest);
00067 }
00068 
00069 /* clear bit */
00070 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_CLEAR_BIT32
00071 L4_INLINE void
00072 l4util_clear_bit32(int b, volatile l4_uint32_t * dest)
00073 {
00074   __asm__ __volatile__
00075     (
00076      "btrl  %1,%0   \n\t"
00077      :
00078      :
00079      "m"   (*dest),   /* 0 mem, destination operand */
00080      "Ir"  (b)        /* 1,     bit number */
00081      :
00082      "memory", "cc"
00083      );
00084 }
00085 
00086 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_CLEAR_BIT64
00087 L4_INLINE void
00088 l4util_clear_bit64(int b, volatile l4_uint64_t * dest)
00089 {
00090   __asm__ __volatile__
00091     (
00092      "btrl  %1,%0   \n\t"
00093      :
00094      :
00095      "m"   (*dest),   /* 0 mem, destination operand */
00096      "Ir"  (b)        /* 1,     bit number */
00097      :
00098      "memory", "cc"
00099      );
00100 }
00101 
00102 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_CLEAR_BIT
00103 L4_INLINE void
00104 l4util_clear_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00105 {
00106   return l4util_clear_bit64(b, (volatile l4_uint64_t*)dest);
00107 }
00108 
00109 /* change bit */
00110 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_COMPLEMENT_BIT
00111 L4_INLINE void
00112 l4util_complement_bit(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00113 {
00114   __asm__ __volatile__
00115     (
00116      "btcq  %1,%0   \n\t"
00117      :
00118      :
00119      "m"   (*dest),   /* 0 mem, destination operand */
00120      "Ir"  ((l4_umword_t)b)        /* 1,     bit number */
00121      :
00122      "memory", "cc"
00123      );
00124 }
00125 
00126 /* test bit */
00127 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_TEST_BIT32
00128 L4_INLINE int
00129 l4util_test_bit32(int b, const volatile l4_uint32_t * dest)
00130 {
00131   l4_int8_t bit;
00132 
00133   __asm__ __volatile__
00134     (
00135      "btl   %2,%1   \n\t"
00136      "setc  %0      \n\t"
00137      :
00138      "=r"  (bit)      /* 0,     old bit value */
00139      :
00140      "m"   (*dest),   /* 1 mem, destination operand */
00141      "Ir"  (b)        /* 2,     bit number */
00142      :
00143      "memory", "cc"
00144      );
00145 
00146   return (int)bit;
00147 }
00148 
00149 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_TEST_BIT64
00150 L4_INLINE int
00151 l4util_test_bit64(int b, const volatile l4_uint64_t * dest)
00152 {
00153   l4_int8_t bit;
00154 
00155   __asm__ __volatile__
00156     (
00157      "btl   %2,%1   \n\t"
00158      "setc  %0      \n\t"
00159      :
00160      "=r"  (bit)      /* 0,     old bit value */
00161      :
00162      "m"   (*dest),   /* 1 mem, destination operand */
00163      "Ir"  (b)        /* 2,     bit number */
00164      :
00165      "memory", "cc"
00166      );
00167 
00168   return (int)bit;
00169 }
00170 
00171 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_TEST_BIT
00172 L4_INLINE int
00173 l4util_test_bit(int b, const volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00174 {
00175   return l4util_test_bit64(b, (const volatile l4_uint64_t *)dest);
00176 }

00179 /* bit test and set */
00180 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_TEST_AND_SET
00181 L4_INLINE int
00182 l4util_bts(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00183 {
00184   l4_int8_t bit;
00185 
00186   __asm__ __volatile__
00187     (
00188      "btsl  %2,%1   \n\t"
00189      "setc  %0      \n\t"
00190      :
00191      "=r"  (bit)      /* 0,     old bit value */
00192      :
00193      "m"   (*dest),   /* 1 mem, destination operand */
00194      "Ir"  (b)        /* 2,     bit number */
00195      :
00196      "memory", "cc"
00197      );
00198 
00199   return (int)bit;
00200 }
00201 
00202 /* bit test and reset */
00203 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_TEST_AND_RESET
00204 L4_INLINE int
00205 l4util_btr(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00206 {
00207   l4_int8_t bit;
00208 
00209   __asm__ __volatile__
00210     (
00211      "btrl  %2,%1   \n\t"
00212      "setc  %0      \n\t"
00213      :
00214      "=r"  (bit)      /* 0,     old bit value */
00215      :
00216      "m"   (*dest),   /* 1 mem, destination operand */
00217      "Ir"  (b)        /* 2,     bit number */
00218      :
00219      "memory", "cc"
00220      );
00221 
00222   return (int)bit;
00223 }
00224 
00225 /* bit test and complement */
00226 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_TEST_AND_COMPLEMENT
00227 L4_INLINE int
00228 l4util_btc(int b, volatile l4_umword_t * dest)
00229 {
00230   l4_int8_t bit;
00231 
00232   __asm__ __volatile__
00233     (
00234      "btc   %2,%1   \n\t"
00235      "setc  %0      \n\t"
00236      :
00237      "=r"  (bit)      /* 0,     old bit value */
00238      :
00239      "m"   (*dest),   /* 1 mem, destination operand */
00240      "Ir"  ((l4_umword_t)b)        /* 2,     bit number */
00241      :
00242      "memory", "cc"
00243      );
00244 
00245   return (int)bit;
00246 }
00247 
00248 /* bit scan reverse */
00249 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_SCAN_REVERSE
00250 L4_INLINE int
00251 l4util_bsr(l4_umword_t word)
00252 {
00253   l4_umword_t tmp;
00254 
00255   if (EXPECT_FALSE(word == 0))
00256     return -1;
00257 
00258   __asm__ __volatile__
00259     (
00260      "bsr %1,%0 \n\t"
00261      :
00262      "=r" (tmp)       /* 0, index of most significant set bit */
00263      :
00264      "r"  (word)      /* 1, argument */
00265      );
00266 
00267   return tmp;
00268 }
00269 
00270 /* bit scan forwad */
00271 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_BIT_SCAN_FORWARD
00272 L4_INLINE int
00273 l4util_bsf(l4_umword_t word)
00274 {
00275   l4_umword_t tmp;
00276 
00277   if (EXPECT_FALSE(word == 0))
00278     return -1;
00279 
00280   __asm__ __volatile__
00281     (
00282      "bsf %1,%0 \n\t"
00283      :
00284      "=r" (tmp)       /* 0, index of least significant set bit */
00285      :
00286      "r"  (word)      /* 1, argument */
00287      );
00288 
00289   return tmp;
00290 }
00291 
00292 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_FIND_FIRST_SET_BIT
00293 L4_INLINE int
00294 l4util_find_first_set_bit(const void * dest, l4_size_t size)
00295 {
00296   l4_mword_t dummy0, dummy1, res;
00297 
00298   __asm__ __volatile__
00299     (
00300      "xor  %%rax,%%rax    \n\t"
00301      "repe; scasl   \n\t"
00302      "jz    1f      \n\t"
00303      "lea  -4(%%rdi),%%rdi  \n\t"
00304      "bsfq  (%%rdi),%%rax \n"
00305      "1:      \n\t"
00306      "sub  %%rbx,%%rdi    \n\t"
00307      "shl  $3,%%rdi   \n\t"
00308      "add  %%rdi,%%rax    \n\t"
00309      :
00310      "=a" (res), "=&c" (dummy0), "=&D" (dummy1)
00311      :
00312      "1" ((size + 31) >> 5), "2" (dest), "b" (dest)
00313      :
00314      "cc", "memory");
00315 
00316   return res;
00317 }
00318 
00319 #define __L4UTIL_BITOPS_HAVE_ARCH_FIND_FIRST_ZERO_BIT
00320 L4_INLINE int
00321 l4util_find_first_zero_bit(const void * dest, l4_size_t size)
00322 {
00323   l4_mword_t dummy0, dummy1, dummy2, res;
00324 
00325   if (!size)
00326     return 0;
00327 
00328   __asm__ __volatile__
00329     (
00330      "mov   $-1,%%rax   \n\t"
00331      "xor   %%rdx,%%rdx \n\t"
00332      "repe;  scasl    \n\t"
00333      "je     1f     \n\t"
00334      "xor   -4(%%rdi),%%rax \n\t"
00335      "sub   $4,%%rdi    \n\t"
00336      "bsf   %%rax,%%rdx \n"
00337      "1:      \n\t"
00338      "sub   %[dest],%%rdi \n\t"
00339      "shl   $3,%%rdi    \n\t"
00340      "add   %%rdi,%%rdx \n\t"
00341      :
00342      "=d" (res), "=&c" (dummy0), "=&D" (dummy1), "=&a" (dummy2)
00343      :
00344      "1" ((size + 31) >> 5), "2" (dest), [dest] "S" (dest)
00345      :
00346      "cc", "memory");
00347 
00348   return res;
00349 }
00350 
00351 EXTERN_C_END
